exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 1 branch or a conjunctive pattern made of 2 patterns.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
r: nat
q: nat
p: nat
H_q3_q: 0 < q -> q * q + 2 <= q * q * q + 2 * q

Goal:
p = expo r q -> expo_conditions

Premises:
Notation expo := (mscal Init.Nat.mul 1)
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
Nat.div_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> q = a / b
euclid_2 : forall n : nat, exists q : nat, n = 2 * q \/ n = 1 + 2 * q
expo_congruence : forall b_nat : nat, 2 <= b_nat -> forall (q : nat) (Hm : b_nat * q - q * q - 1 <> 0) (n : nat), 0 < n -> nat2Zp Hm (q * alpha_nat b_nat n) = nat2Zp Hm (alpha_nat b_nat (n - 1) + expo n q)
Nat.mod_unique : forall a b q r : nat, r < b -> a = b * q + r -> r = a mod b
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
utils_nat.pow2_dec_uniq : forall p a q b : nat, utils_nat.pow2 p * (2 * a + 1) = utils_nat.pow2 q * (2 * b + 1) -> p = q /\ a = b
mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
divides_le : forall p q : nat, q <> 0 -> divides p q -> p <= q
plus_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n + p <= m + q
is_gcd_modulus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> k <= q -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q - k) r
is_lcm_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_lcm p q r -> is_lcm q p r
is_gcd_sym : forall p q r : nat, is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd q p r
is_gcd_moduplus : forall p q k r : nat, divides p k -> is_gcd p q r -> is_gcd p (q + k) r
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
divides_mult : forall p q k : nat, divides p q -> divides p (k * q)
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
expo_congruence_Z : forall b_nat : nat, 2 <= b_nat -> forall (q : nat) (Hm : b_nat * q - q * q - 1 <> 0) (n : nat), Zp_mult Hm (nat2Zp Hm q) (Z2Zp Hm (alpha_Z b_nat (S n))) = Zp_plus Hm (Z2Zp Hm (alpha_Z b_nat n)) (nat2Zp Hm (expo n q))
prime.prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime.prime _%nat_scope
is_gcd_fun : forall p q r1 r2 : nat, is_gcd p q r1 -> is_gcd p q r2 -> r1 = r2
is_gcd_div : forall p q : nat, divides p q -> is_gcd p q p
m_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (b_nat q : nat) (Hm : b_nat * q - q * q - 1 <> 0) (n : nat) (l : list (Z_Zp (b_nat * q - q * q - 1))) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist (Zp_zero Hm) (Zp_one Hm) (Zp_plus Hm) (Zp_mult Hm) (fun x y : Z_Zp (b_nat * q - q * q - 1) => Zp_plus Hm x (Zp_opp Hm y)) (Zp_opp Hm) eq (gen_phiZ (Zp_zero Hm) (Zp_one Hm) (Zp_plus Hm) (Zp_mult Hm) (Zp_opp Hm)) id_phi_N (pow_N (Zp_one H...
prime.prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime.prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.testbit_unique : forall (a n : nat) (a0 : bool) (l h : nat), l < 2 ^ n -> a = l + (Nat.b2n a0 + 2 * h) * 2 ^ n -> Nat.testbit a n = a0
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope

```coq
unfold expo_conditions.
destruct (euclid_2 r) as [q | q].
- exists q. split.
  + apply H_q3_q. omega.
  + unfold expo. rewrite mult_le_compat with (n := q) (m := q) (p := 1) (q := 1). omega.
- exists q. split.
  + apply H_q3_q. omega.
  + unfold expo. rewrite mult_le_compat with (n := q) (m := q) (p := 1) (q := 1). omega.
Qed.
```
